DataElement.preferredName: Person Clinical Study Agent Hypersensitivity Exclusion Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to a person's hypersensitivity or allergy to study agent that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Clinical Study Agent Hypersensitivity Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person's hypersensitivity or allergy to study agent that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

Property.preferredName: Clinical Study Agent Hypersensitivity Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):An exaggerated response by the immune system to a drug or other substance.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
An exaggerated response by the immune system to a drug or other substance.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the subject had a prior reaction or have an inability to tolerate any of the dental products being used (such as severe topical or hypersensitivity reaction)

ReferenceDocuments.name: History of allergy or hyperse
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of allergy or hypersensitivity to agents chemically similar to AFP464

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of severe hypersensitivity reaction to Taxotere (docetaxel) or other drugs formulated with polysorbate 80?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reaction to Cephalosporin

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known immediate or delayed hypersensitivity reaction or idiosyncrasy to drugs chemically related to the study drug, or excipients, or to dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO), or to Cremophor EL (polyoxyethylated castor oil)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known immediate or delayed hypersensitivity reaction or idiosyncrasy to drugs chemically related to trametinib, GSK2141795 or dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient allergic or hypersensitive to CHG?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biological composition to INCB024360, MELITAC 12.1, or other vaccine components

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known hypersensitivity to indicated agent

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known sensitivity reactions to products containing Cremaphor EL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to EGEN-001 or other agents used in this study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reaction to a cephalosporin

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to CDX-1401 or CDX-301 or poly-ICLC

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known immediate or delayed hypersensitivity reaction or idiosyncrasy to drugs chemically related to Trametinib, or excipients, or to dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO), or to Cremophor EL (polyoxyethylated castor oil)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to MK-3475

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, does the patient have known hypersensitivity to anthracenedione or other anthracyclines?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAI141
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant have a history of allergic reaction attributable to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to 18F- fluorothymidine?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAI142 Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of allergic reaction attributable to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to 18F-FES?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biological composition to Anti-LAG-3, Anti-CD137, and Anti-PD1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known hypersensitivity to pembrolizumab or any of its excipients

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of hypersensitivity to conductive hydrogel?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_Text_14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of allergic reaction to medications that have a benzamide structure

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have prior allergic reaction or hypersensitivity to study agents

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to AMG 232?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergy or hypersensitivity to agents chemically similar to Ribociclib or its excipients ?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have hypersensitivity to indicated agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to MK-3475 (pembrolizumab) or Interferon-gamma.  Patients who are hypersensitive to E. Coli are also excluded.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CE7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of a prior allergic reaction to memantine?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of severe hypersensitivity reaction to any monoclonal antibody?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known hypersensitivity to any of the study drugs or any of the study drug excipients?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_TEXT 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of severe (grade 3-4) hypersensitivity reaction to any monoclonal antibody including nivolumab and/or any of its excipients?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a contraindication to memantine, such as allergy or prior reaction, intractable seizures, current use of NMDA agonist, or alcohol or drug abuse which can exacerbate lethargy or dizziness with memantine?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of a severe hypersensitivity reaction to monoclonal antibody or pembrolizumab (MK-3475) and/or its excipients; and/or a severe hypersensitivity reaction to paclitaxel and/or carboplatin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of hypersensitivity to olanzapine or megestrol acetate?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition of study agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have hypersensitivity to letermovir or any component of the formulation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have prior allergic reaction or hypersensitivity to cetuximab, xevinapant, or any of its excipients?
